column3: Tested on Ubuntu 16.04: [Image](https://i.imgur.com/2DmIUsK.png)\nNano nit: '200GB'/'15GB' should be '200 GB'/'15 GB' for the sake of consistency.

Thanks for addressing this issue.\n\nWe generally try to avoid having explicit branching on the network type. Instead, I would suggest adding a variable to CChainParams (which is initialized differently in the different network versions).
Okay, thanks! This will be cleaner.\nI will update this PR with the CChainParams approach.
>  I will update this PR with the CChainParams approach.\n\nDon't forget to update the release process document as well.
Concept ACK.
Concept ACK
utACK,... maybe simplify the code according to https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13229

@jonasschnelli, if #13229 is acceptable, I prefer dropping this PR in favor of #13229. No need to re-do the work here and your approach seems better.\n\nJust as a heads up, it seems that #13229 also explicitly branches the network type (see @sipa's suggestion above). I'm new to the code base and I can't tell for sure if using CChainParams for this Qt issue will be better for the rest of the code
I think it is fine to put it in chainparams, if you call it `m_assumed_size` (similar to "assumed valid").

> @jonasschnelli, if #13229 is acceptable, I prefer dropping this PR in favor of #13229. No need to re-do the work here and your approach seems better.

Please continue with this and feel free to grab code from 13229...

I had the feeling that this would be GUI only and not appropriate to put Into the chainparams holder... but @sipa and @MarcoFalke think its better there which I guess they

Updated do address @sipa's review.\nMy only comment for now is that the intro message is a bit funny warning that you need at least 0GB... even though that's accurate. :)\nThe message already didn't totally reflect regtest's reality anyway but let me know if anybody thinks this should be addressed for some reason I can't think of.

You can't include core files directly (this is part of ongoing work to separate the two more cleanly); you'll need to go through the node interface (see the include below).
ooops, okay
do you have any suggestion for this value? thanks
I see! Thank you, I will fix this as soon as I get back.

0 or 1? :)\n\nIt doesn't matter, and it's also unpredictable, as it depends on what blocks are created (regtest is purely for testing purposes, and all blocks are typically explicitly created in the test; there is no real network).
Please note that the comment is already opened with `/*` on the line above :-)
Please note that `requiredSpace` is redefined four lines below :-)
Should catch by reference instead of value. Also missing space before `(` :-)
Except this one, other issues were caused by a (obviously bad) merge conflict resolution - bad. I'll take a lot more care so it doesn't happen again.\nThank you for taking the time to review it.
Note that this will hide all error messages from `selectParams`

Do you think this should be addressed here or could wait for the next maintenance (since the release process now asks for this to be changed)?
